member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.ShapeData
member.summary: Contains the cached coordinates of the key points of a shape when the shape is applied to a specific ShapeNode. This class also stores additional data passed to custom shape-generation callbacks and to shape formula scripts.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.IPersists
member.summary: Base interface for serializable MindFusion.Diagramming objects.

member.returns: An integer value specifying a unique id for the implementing class.

A PersistContext object supplying all necessary information during serialization.

A PersistContext object supplying all necessary information during deserialization.

The referenced object.
A PersistContext object supplying all necessary information during deserialization.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.EffectPropertyChangedEventArgs
member.summary: Contains the arguments passed to handlers of the PropertyChanged event of the NodeEffect class.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.NodeEffect
member.summary: Represents the base class of all visual effects that can be applied to the nodes in a Diagram.
member.remarks: Effects can be applied by adding instances of the concrete effect classes to the NodeEffects collection of the Diagram.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.NodeEffect.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the NodeEffect class.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.NodeEffect.Apply(MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode,MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode.DrawParams,MindFusion.Diagramming.EffectPhase)
member.summary: Applies this effect to the specified node.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.NodeEffect.RaisePropertyChanged(System.String)
member.summary: Raises the PropertyChanged for the specified property.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.NodeEffect.RaisePropertyChanged(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Raises the PropertyChanged for the specified property and flag.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.NodeEffect.PropertyChanged
member.summary: INotifyPropertyChanged.PropertyChanged implementation.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.EffectPhase
member.summary: Specifies the rendering phase during which an effect application is requested.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.EffectPhase.BeforeFill
member.summary: Indicates that the NodeEffect.Apply method is invoked before the target node is filled.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.EffectPhase.AfterFill
member.summary: Indicates that the NodeEffect.Apply method is invoked after the target node is filled.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.EffectPhase.AfterOutline
member.summary: Indicates that the NodeEffect.Apply method is invoked after the target node is stroked.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.GlassEffect
member.summary: Represents a glass-like visual effect.
member.remarks: This effect can be applied to the nodes in a Diagram by adding an instance of this class to the NodeEffects collection.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.GlassEffect.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the GlassEffect class.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.GlassEffect.Apply(MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode,MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode.DrawParams,MindFusion.Diagramming.EffectPhase)
member.summary: NodeEffect.Apply override.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.GlassEffect.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the glass effect.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.GlassEffect.GlowColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the glow portion of the effect.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.GlassEffect.UsePenAsGlow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the glow portion of the effect should be painted with the Pen color of the respective node.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.GlassEffect.ReflectionColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the reflection portion of the effect.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.GlassEffectType
member.summary: Specifies the type of a GlassEffect node effect.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.GlassEffectType.Type1
member.summary: Indicates a glass effect with soft radial glow at the bottom and a sharp reflection at the top.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.GlassEffectType.Type2
member.summary: Indicates a glass effect with linear glow at the bottom and sharp reflection at the top.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.GlassEffectType.Type3
member.summary: Indicates a glass effect with radial glow at the bottom and smooth reflection and emphasized outline at the top.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.GlassEffectType.Type4
member.summary: Indicates a glass effect with sharp reflection at the top and soft glow at the left and right sides.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.AeroEffect
member.summary: Represents an effect that adds semitransparency to the node and emphasizes its outline by adding a shade and an inner stroke.
member.remarks: This effect can be applied to the nodes in a Diagram by adding an instance of this class to the NodeEffects collection.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.AeroEffect.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the AeroEffect class.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.AeroEffect.Apply(MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode,MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode.DrawParams,MindFusion.Diagramming.EffectPhase)
member.summary: NodeEffect.Apply override.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.AeroEffect.ApplyOpacity(System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Applies the effect's opacity to the specified color, multiplicatively.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.AeroEffect.Opacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the opacity to apply to the node's background.
member.remarks: Opacity varies in the range [0..1] where 0 indicates full transparency and 1 indicates the original transparency. Opacity has no effect on image backgrounds.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.AeroEffect.ShadeColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the shade.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.AeroEffect.InnerOutlineColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the inner outline.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.EmbossEffect
member.summary: Represents an emboss effect.
member.remarks: This effect can be applied to the nodes in a Diagram by adding an instance of this class to the NodeEffects collection. In addition, this effect will be active only when the Diagram.EffectProvider property is set to an object implementing the GenerateEmboss method of the IEffectsProvider interface.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.EmbossEffect.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the EmbossEffect class.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.EmbossEffect.Prepare(MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode)
member.summary: NodeEffect.Prepare override.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.EmbossEffect.Apply(MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode,MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode.DrawParams,MindFusion.Diagramming.EffectPhase)
member.summary: NodeEffect.Apply override.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.SmoothShadowEffect
member.summary: Represents an effect that smooths the shadow of nodes. This effect does nothing if shadows are not visible.
member.remarks: This effect can be applied to the nodes in a Diagram by adding an instance of this class to the NodeEffects collection. In addition, this effect will be active only when the Diagram.EffectProvider property is set to an object implementing the GenerateShadow method of the IEffectsProvider interface.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.SmoothShadowEffect.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SmoothShadowEffect class.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.SmoothShadowEffect.Prepare(MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode)
member.summary: NodeEffect.Prepare override.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.SmoothShadowEffect.Apply(MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode,MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode.DrawParams,MindFusion.Diagramming.EffectPhase)
member.summary: NodeEffect.Apply override.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.SmoothShadowEffect.Dispersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the shadow dispersion.
member.remarks: This property is hidden because it slows down performance with bigger values.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Commands.ExpandItemCmd
member.summary: Undoable command that implements expanding/collapsing trees of items.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Commands.Command
member.summary: Represent an action that can be carried out on a diagram, and later undone or redone.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Commands.Command.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Command class.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Commands.Command.Execute(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Carries out an action, usually changing the diagram in some way.
member.param: Specifies whether undo/redo is enabled. If undo is disabled, the command won't be saved in undo history and will never be called to undo or redo itself. In such case you might choose to skip some housekeeping operations such as saving state variables for later undo/redo.
member.remarks: Implement your action's logic here. You must not execute commands by calling this method - instead pass them to diagram's ExecuteCommand. ExecuteCommand calls Execute and if UndoEnabled is set to true, adds the command to the undo manager's history.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Commands.Command.Undo
member.summary: Undoes an action, restoring the diagram to the state it was in before carrying out the action.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Commands.Command.Redo
member.summary: Repeats an action that has been undone.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Commands.Command.AddSubCmd(MindFusion.Diagramming.Commands.Command)
member.summary: Adds an action to a composite command.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Commands.Command.FreeUndoResources
member.summary: Called to free the undo data when the command is removed from the undo/redo history.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Commands.Command.FreeRedoResources
member.summary: Called to free the redo data when the command is removed from the undo/redo history.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Commands.Command.GetItem
member.summary: Gets the diagram item associated with the command.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Commands.Command.IsContainerOf(MindFusion.Diagramming.Commands.Command)
member.summary: Determines whether a command has been initiated by this command and should be treated as a derivative.
member.param: The Command for which to determine whether it is a derivative.
member.returns: true if the specified command should be considered a derivative; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Commands.Command.Adopt(MindFusion.Diagramming.Commands.Command)
member.summary: Merges adjacent commands in the history queue if they are related.
member.param: The Command that might be adopted by this command.
member.returns: true if the specified command has been adopted; otherwise, false.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Commands.Command.title
member.summary: Might use this title in Undo/Redo menu item labels e.g. if title == 'Create' -> 'Undo Create' or 'Redo Create'.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Commands.Command.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the text associated with the action.
member.remarks: This text can be used to indicate to users what exactly will be undone or redone.

member.summary: Gets the command's context.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Commands.Command.SubCommands
member.summary: Gets a collection of all command objects contained within the composite one.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramItem

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramItem.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DiagramItem class.
member.remarks: This constructor sets the DiagramItem properties to their default values.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DiagramItem class with default values supplied form the specified Diagram.
member.param: The Diagram from which to obtain default values for the item properties.
member.remarks: This constructor initializes the DiagramItem properties with the values specified in the respective default-value properties of the Diagram object.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramItem.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DiagramItem class.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramItem.#ctor(MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramItem)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DiagramItem class using the specified diagram item as a prototype.
member.param: The item to use as a prototype. The properties of the new item are initialized from the property values of this item.
member.remarks: This constructor copies the DiagramItem property values from the specified prototype item.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramItem.Finalize
member.summary: DiagramItem finalizer.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramItem.Clone(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a copy of this item.
member.param: true if the copy will be stored in the Windows clipboard; otherwise, false.
member.returns: The copy of this item.
member.remarks: The default implementation of this item invokes the item's class copy constructor through reflection. If your custom type does not provide a copy constructor, you must implement this method to provide for clipboard operations support.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Layout.HierarchicalLayout
member.summary: Performs hierarchical layout on simple, connected, level-planar graphs.
member.remarks: The hierarchical layout places vertices on predefined levels, such that if the source graph is level-planar it is guaranteed that all edges will have a single segment and will not intersect. A planar graph is considered level-planar if it is still possible to draw it without edge intersections when its vertices are positioned on predefined levels.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode.IncomingLinks
member.summary: Gets a collection of links that point to the node.
member.remarks: Use this collection to get access to every link pointing to the node, as well as get the number of such links.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode.OutgoingLinks
member.summary: Gets a collection of links that start from this node.
member.remarks: Use this collection to get access to every link starting from the node, as well as get the number of such links.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode.AllowIncomingLinks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether users are allowed to draw incoming links to this node.
member.remarks: Links to a node can be created programmatically regardless of the value of this property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode.AllowOutgoingLinks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether users are allowed to draw outgoing links from this node.
member.remarks: Links from a node can be created programmatically regardless of the value of this property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode.Expandable
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether users are allowed to expand or collapse the subtree that starts from this node.
member.remarks: This property is useful mostly when nodes form a tree-like hierarchical structure.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode.Expanded
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the subtree starting from this node is expanded.
member.remarks: This property is useful mostly when nodes form a tree-like hierarchical structure.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode.Obstacle
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this node is considered an obstacle by the link-routing algorithm.
member.remarks: It is useful to set this property to false for nodes used as decorative containers or labels.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode.Bounds
member.summary: Gets or sets the rectangle that defines the position of the diagram node.
member.remarks: Use this property to set or get the size and/or location of a node. Moving a node also updates the control points coordinates of all links connected to the node.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode.AnchorPattern
member.summary: Gets or sets the anchor points to which links are attached when connected to the node.
member.remarks: This property specifies a set of points to which links can be attached.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode.RealAnchorPattern
member.summary: Gets the anchor pattern associated with this node.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode.Constraints
member.summary: Allows applying constraints to the location and size of the node.
member.remarks: These constraints are considered when a user modifies the node interactively.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode.Frozen
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the node should be ignored by automatic layouts.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode.EnabledHandles
member.summary: Gets or sets the kinds of modifications that end-users are permitted to perform on the node.
member.remarks: Disabling some selection handles allows restricting the types of modifications that users can perform on a node.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the intersecting links in a non-planar graphs will be segmented and bended to improve presentation.

member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the virtual grid the layout will place vertices on.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Layout.TriangularLayout
member.summary: Performs triangular layout on simple, connected graphs.
member.remarks: The triangular layout places vertices on a virtual grid, such that if the source graph is planar it is guaranteed that all edges will have a single segment and will not intersect. If the graph is not planar, the intersecting edges are optionally segmented and bended in order to improve readability.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Layout.SpringLayoutMethod
member.summary: Specifies what energy model SpringLayout should use for the simulation.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Layout.SpringLayoutMethod.Classic
member.summary: Use Hooke's law of elasticity to treat links as springs, and Coulomb's inverse square law to implement repulsion between nodes.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Layout.SpringLayoutMethod.FruchtermanReingold
member.summary: Use artificial attraction forces for links and repulsion forces for nodes that cancel each other at about the distance specified in NodeDistance, along with a simulated cooling schedule used for fine-tuning. Based on the method of Thomas Fruchterman and Edward Reingold.

member.summary: Assigns to the routing properties a predefined set of values which allow finding paths quickly but the found paths are of low quality.

member.summary: Assigns to the routing properties a predefined set of values which allow finding paths that have a small number of segments.

member.summary: Resets the GridSize and NodeVicinitySize to their default values.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.RoutingOptions.NodeVicinitySize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of a buffer zone around a node in which routes get a penalty cost if they pass through it.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.RoutingOptions.CrossingCost
member.summary: Gets or sets a value added to the total cost of a route if it causes a link to cross another link.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.RoutingOptions.LengthCost
member.summary: Gets or sets a value added to the total cost of a route for each piece of the routing grid occupied by the route.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.RoutingOptions.NodeVicinityCost
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of a buffer zone around a node for which routes get a penalty cost if they pass through it.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.RoutingOptions.TurnCost
member.summary: Gets or sets a value added to the total cost of a route if it makes a turn.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.RoutingOptions.EndPointsOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum number of routing grid cells the end segments of links should occupy before they are allowed to bend.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.RoutingOptions.DontOptimizeLongRoutes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether long routes don't have their number of segments minimized in order to save up processing time.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.RoutingOptions.TriggerRerouting
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating under what circumstances links are rerouted automatically.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.RoutingOptions.EndOrientation

member.summary: For internal use.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.RoutingOptions.SmartPolylineEnds
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the end segments of polyline links should be oriented orthogonally to the node bounds.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.RoutingOptions.RouteHeuristics
member.summary: Gets or sets a heuristic function used to evaluate the distance between two pieces of the routing grid.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.RoutingOptions.MaxAbs
member.summary: Gets a heuristic delegate function that returns max(dx, dy) as a cost evaluation of the distance between two pieces of the routing grid.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.RoutingOptions.DistSquare
member.summary: Gets a heuristic delegate function that returns the square distance dx^2 + dy^2 as a cost evaluation of the distance between two pieces of the routing grid.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.RoutingOptions.Distance
member.summary: Gets a heuristic delegate function that returns the real distance sqrt(dx^2 + dy^2) between two pieces of the routing grid.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.RoundRectangleTemplate
member.summary: Represents an ElementTemplate that draws round rectangle.
member.remarks: This class ensures that the round corners do not change during resizing which is visually better. The drawback is that the radius appears to be specified in DiagramViewMeasure units and therefore a given shape instance will look bad when the measure unit is not the one for which the shape was designed.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.ConnectionPoint
member.summary: This class represents a connection between an edge and a node in a graph. It decouples the DiagramLink class from the DiagramNode class, allowing edges to connect different types of nodes without knowing anything of their implementation details. Each DiagramLink object contains two ConnectionPoint instances describing the connections at both ends of the link.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.XmlPersistContext.brushes
member.summary: A map of all diagram brushes.
member.remarks: During serialization, this map will contain all serialized brushes, mapped to their indices. During deserialization, the brushes are loaded from the appropriate section in the Xml file, the first time they are accessed. This list is of type (Brush, int) when serializing and of type (int, Brush) when deserializing.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.XmlPersistContext.images
member.summary: A map of all diagram images.
member.remarks: During serialization, this map will contain all serialized images, mapped to their indices. During deserialization, the images are loaded from the appropriate section in the Xml file, the first time they are accessed. This list is of type (Image, int) when serializing and of type (int, Image) when deserializing.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.TreeEnumerator
member.summary: Enables an easy standard method to iterate over the elements of a tree-like structure of objects.
member.remarks: The TreeEnumerator class implements the standard .NET IEnumerator interface. It provides an easy method to iterate over the elements of a tree-like structure of diagram items.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.TreeEnumerator.#ctor(MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TreeEnumerator class.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.TreeEnumerator.#ctor(MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TreeEnumerator class.
member.param: The root of the tree or subtree to be enumerated.
Specifies whether to enumerate links.
Specifies whether to check strictly if the passed structure is a tree.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.TreeEnumerator.BuildTree(MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode)
member.summary: Generates a list with all items in the tree with the specified root.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.TreeEnumerator.MoveNext
member.summary: Advances the enumerator to the next element of the tree.
member.returns: true if the enumerator has successfully passed to the next DiagramItem in the collection; false if there are no more elements available to enumerate.
member.remarks: Initially an enumerator is positioned before the first element of the tree (the root), and the first call to MoveNext moves the enumerator over that first element.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.TreeEnumerator.Reset
member.summary: Sets the enumerator to its initial position, which is before the first element in the collection.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.TreeEnumerator.Current
member.summary: Gets the current element of the iteration.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.NotATreeException
member.summary: An exception raised by the TreeEnumerator class if the specified node does not represent a root of a tree.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.ILinkRouter
member.summary: Defines methods that should be implemented by a link-router component. The control calls them when a new link path should be set in response to changes in the diagram, such as adding or modifying nodes.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.ILinkRouter.RouteLink(MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink)
member.summary: Called when a single link must be routed.
member.param: A DiagramLink object representing the link.
member.returns: true if a path has been found, otherwise false.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.ILinkRouter.RouteLinks(MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLinkCollection)
member.summary: Called when more than one links must be routed.
member.param: A DiagramLinkCollection containing the links that should be routed.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.ILinkRouter.Suspend
member.summary: Called when the control starts a batch update operation that might affect many links. Implementations might collect the links specified through RouteLink and RouteLinks calls and defer finding their paths for when Resume is called.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.ILinkRouter.Resume(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Called when the control ends a batch update operation that might affect many links.
member.param: true if the links should be routed, otherwise false.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.ILinkRouter.Diagram
member.summary: Gets or sets the diagram this router is associated with.

member.summary: Specifies a set of link identifiers for which nodes connected via such links will be placed rightwards from already arranged nodes. You can assign a single logic identifier or an array of identifiers to this property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.ConnectorRules.UpOriented
member.summary: Specifies a set of link identifiers for which nodes connected via such links will be placed upwards from already arranged nodes. You can assign a single logic identifier or an array of identifiers to this property.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Layout.FlowLayoutRules.UseRuleManagedLinkBend(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Specifies whether FlowLayout should use custom link-bending rules specified through the various Add*BendRule methods.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Layout.FractalLayout
member.summary: A tree drawing algorithm that places child nodes symmetrically around their parent node.
member.remarks: Nodes at the lowest level are arranged directly in a circle around their parent. At the upper level, the already arranged nodes form branches that are arranged in a circle around the new parent node. The algorithm is recursively repeated till the highest level is reached.

The top side of the node's bounding rectangle, expressed as percent of the main node height.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Commands.AddItemCmd
member.summary: Implements creation of new diagram items.
member.remarks: Instances of this class are implicitly created by MindFusion.Diagramming in response to users drawing new items or to programmatically calling the Add method of the diagram's Nodes or Links collections. References to those instances are passed to handlers of the ActionRecorded, ActionUndone and ActionRedone events.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Shape
member.summary: An instance of this class represents a shape defined through a series of arc, line and Bezier segments. The segments can be a part of the shape outline, in which case they define the part of the shape is filled, used for hit-testing and for aligning arrows to the node edges. Segments can also be added as decoration elements, in which case they only affect the appearance of a ShapeNode.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Shape.#cctor
member.summary: Initializes the predefined static shapes.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Shape.#ctor(MindFusion.Diagramming.ElementTemplate[],System.Drawing.Drawing2D.FillMode)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Shape class with the specified outline.
member.param: An array of shape template elements that define the outline of a shape. Can contain lines, arcs and Bézier curves.
Specifies how areas are filled if the outline path intersects itself.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Shape.#ctor(MindFusion.Diagramming.ElementTemplate[],System.Drawing.Drawing2D.FillMode,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Shape class with the specified outline and id.
member.param: Refers to an array of shape template elements that define the outline of a shape. Can contain lines, arcs and Bézier curves.
Specifies how areas are filled if the outline path intersects itself.
The string identifier of the new shape.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Shape.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Shape class with the specified outline.
member.param: An array containing even number of coordinate values, which define the points of the shape outline.
member.remarks: The specified array should contain even number of values. Each odd value represents the x-coordinate and each even value represents the y-coordinate of the corresponding point in the shape outline.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Shape.#ctor(System.Byte[],System.String)

member.remarks: The specified array should contain even number of values.
The specified array should contain even number of values. Each odd value represents the x-coordinate and each even value represents the y-coordinate of the corresponding point in the shape outline.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Shape.#ctor(MindFusion.Diagramming.ElementTemplate[],MindFusion.Diagramming.ElementTemplate[],MindFusion.Diagramming.ElementTemplate[],System.Drawing.Drawing2D.FillMode)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Shape class with the specified outline, decorations and text area.
member.param: An array of shape template elements that define the outline of a shape. Can contain lines, arcs and Bézier curves.
An array of shape template elements that define shape decorations. Can contain lines, arcs and Bézier curves. Decorations are visual elements that do not take part in hit testing and clipping.

An array of shape template elements that define the region of a node in which text is laid out and rendered. Can contain lines, arcs and Bézier curves. Latter two are approximated to polygons by the text-formatting algorithm.
Specifies how areas are filled if the outline path intersects itself.

An array of shape template elements that define the region of a node in which text is laid out and rendered. Can contain lines, arcs and Bézier curves. Latter two are approximated to polygons by the text-formatting algorithm.

member.returns: true if the current shape is equivalent to the specified shape; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Identifies possible incoming links in FlowLayout rules.

member.summary: For internal use.

member.summary: A boolean value specifying the alignment of nodes within a group.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Layout.HierarchicalLayoutTraits
member.summary: Indicates item traits specific to hierarchical layouts. Members of this enumeration can be used as keys in the DiagramItem.LayoutTraits hashtable.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Layout.HierarchicalLayoutTraits.Level
member.summary: The number associated with this key specifies the index of the level of the item in the level-planar graph.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayoutTraits
member.summary: Indicates item traits specific to layered layouts. Members of this enumeration can be used as keys in the DiagramItem.LayoutTraits hashtable.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayoutTraits.Layer
member.summary: The number associated with this key specifies the index of the layer the layout should attempt to place the node to. Specifying a negative number indicates a layer starting from the last. For example, -1 would indicate the last layer, -2 - the layer before the last, and so on.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Layout.SpringLayoutTraits
member.summary: Indicates item traits specific to SpringLayout. Members of this enumeration can be used as keys in the DiagramItem.LayoutTraits hashtable.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Layout.SpringLayoutTraits.Frozen
member.summary: If the LayoutTraits value associated with a node through this key is true, SpringLayout considers the repulsion forces exerted by the node to other nodes, but ignores forces acting on the node and keeps it in place.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Layout.SwimlaneLayoutTraits
member.summary: Indicates item traits specific to swimlane layouts. Members of this enumeration can be used as keys in the DiagramItem.LayoutTraits hashtable.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Layout.SwimlaneLayoutTraits.Lane
member.summary: Specifies the lane to which a node should be assigned.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Layout.SwimlaneLayoutTraits.SortOrder
member.summary: Specifies custom sort order of nodes in the same lane.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Layout.TreeLayoutTraits
member.summary: Indicates item traits specific to tree layouts. Members of this enumeration can be used as keys in the DiagramItem.LayoutTraits hashtable.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Layout.TreeLayoutTraits.Assistant
member.summary: If the LayoutTraits value associated with a node through this key is true, the CenterTreeLayout treats this node as an "assistant" during the arrangement. If the value is false or is not present, the node is treated as "subordinate". The associated value can also be of type AssistantType if it is required to specify the position of the assistant node relative to its parent.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Layout.AssistantType
member.summary: Indicates the type of an assistant node in a tree.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Layout.AssistantType.None
member.summary: The node is not an assistant.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Layout.AssistantType.Normal
member.summary: The node is an assistant and its relative position is determined automatically by the layout.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Layout.AssistantType.Left
member.summary: The node is an assistant and it is always positioned to the left of its parent.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Layout.AssistantType.Right
member.summary: The node is an assistant and it is always positioned to the right of its parent.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Lanes.ResizeType
member.summary: Specifies how to resize child columns and rows in the lanes grid when their parent column or row is resized.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Lanes.ResizeType.Fixed
member.summary: The header's size (width or height) is fixed and does not change when its parent header is being resized unless all its siblings have fixed size too.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Lanes.ResizeType.Proportional
member.summary: The header resizes in proportion to its parent header.

member.summary: Inserts the specified Header at the specified position within the HeaderCollection.

The Header object to insert.
member.remarks: Use this method to insert Header objects at a specific position in the collection. If you do not need to specify header's position, use the Add method instead, which adds new headers to the end of the list.

member.summary: Removes the first occurrence of the specified Header from the collection.
member.param: The Header object to remove.
member.remarks: Use this method to remove headers from the collection. Headers can be added to the collection with the Add or Insert methods.

member.summary: Removes the Header at the specified position within the collection.

member.summary: Gets the index of the specified header within this collection.

member.summary: Checks whether a Header is in the collection.

member.returns: true if the header was found in the collection; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Call the method to determine whether a Header is contained within the collection. If not, you can add it with the Add method. Otherwise, if it is there, you can remove it with Remove.

The last DiagramNode in the Path.
member.returns: A collection of Path objects; if no paths are found, the collection is empty.

The last DiagramNode in the Path.
The maximum number of paths to find.
member.returns: A collection of Path objects; if no paths are found, the collection is empty.
member.remarks: The returned Path instances include the from an to nodes.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.PathFinder.FindShortestPath(MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode,MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode)
member.summary: Finds and returns the shortest Path between the specified DiagramNode objects.
member.param: The first DiagramNode in the Path.
The last DiagramNode in the Path.
member.returns: A Path instance that represents the shortest path found; null (Nothing in Visual Basic) if there is no path connecting from and to.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.PathFinder.FindShortestPath(MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode,MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Finds and returns the shortest path between two DiagramNode elements, considering the Weight of the nodes, the Weight of the links or both.
member.param: The first DiagramNode in the Path.
The last DiagramNode in the Path.
If true, the Path with minimal total weight is found, summing the Weight of nodes in the Path.
If true, the Path with minimal total weight is found, summing the Weight of links in the Path.
member.returns: A Path instance that represents the shortest Path found or null (Nothing in Visual Basic) if there is no Path connecting from and to.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink.OriginAnchor
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the origin anchor point within the AnchorPattern that contains it.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink.DestinationAnchor
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the destination anchor point within the AnchorPattern that contains it.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink.SegmentCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of segments of this link.
member.remarks: Use this property to make a link more indented, when necessary.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink.InternalSegmentCount
member.summary: Invoked internally to set the segment count unconditionally (i.e. when loading from XML).

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink.IsConnected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the link is connected to nodes at both its ends.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink.Origin
member.summary: Gets or sets the origin node of the link.
member.remarks: The link's origin can be changed programmatically with this property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink.Destination
member.summary: Gets or sets the destination node of this link.
member.remarks: The link's destination can be changed programmatically with this property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink.OriginConnection
member.summary: Gets or sets the ConnectionPoint object representing the link connection to its origin node. This allows connecting the link to a constituent part of a node, such as a TableNode row or a TreeViewItem.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink.DestinationConnection
member.summary: Gets or sets the ConnectionPoint object representing the link connection to its destination node. This allows connecting the link to a constituent part of a node, such as a TableNode row or a TreeViewItem.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink.OriginIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of link's origin anchor point or table row.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink.DestinationIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of link's destination anchor point or table row.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink.Dynamic
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a link automatically adjusts its end points positions in order to keep pointing to the centers of nodes that it connects.
member.remarks: Use the property to specify whether a link automatically repositions its end segments, so they keep pointing to the centers of nodes connected by that link.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink.RetainForm
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a link should maintain its form if the nodes connected with that link are moved around.
member.remarks: RetainForm is useful for links that have more than two control points.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink.AutoRoute
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a link should avoid nodes by going the shortest path from its origin to its destination without crossing any other nodes.
member.remarks: If AutoRoute is enabled, a link automatically finds the shortest possible path between its origin and destination that doesn't intersect Obstacle nodes.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink.CascadeOrientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of the first segment of a cascading link.
member.remarks: Use this property to specify the orientation of the first segment of a link whose Style is set to Cascading.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink.CascadeStartHorizontal
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating the orientation of the initial segment of a cascading link.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink.CascadeEndHorizontal
member.summary: Gets a flag indicating the orientation of the last segment of a cascading link.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink.AllowMoveStart
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user is allowed to move the first control point of a link.
member.remarks: Set the property to false to prevent the link origin to be changed interactively.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink.AllowMoveEnd
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user is allowed to move the end point of a link.
member.remarks: Set the property to false to prevent the link destination to be changed interactively.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink.Visible
member.summary: DiagramItem.Visible override.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink.DrawCrossings
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the points where this link crosses other links should be drawn as arcs or dashes.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink.CustomDraw
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of custom drawing performed on this link.
member.remarks: This property allows invoking custom painting code for a link.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink.AutoSnapToNode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether link end points should automatically align to the border of the nearest node while the user moves them.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink.HandlesStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the appearance of the link's selection handles.
member.remarks: Specifies how link's selection status is indicated visually.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink.Length
member.summary: Gets the length of the link.
member.remarks: If the link's Style is set to Bezier, an approximate length is calculated.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink.Bounds
member.summary: Gets the size of the rectangle that bounds this link.
member.remarks: Use the property to get the smallest rectangle that bounds all link points.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink.BaseBrush

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink.SilentAutoRoute

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Anchoring
member.summary: Defines values that specify how automatic layout algorithms align links to anchor points.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Anchoring.Ignore
member.summary: Anchor points are ignored.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Anchoring.Keep
member.summary: Links are aligned to their original anchor points.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Anchoring.Reassign
member.summary: Links are aligned to new anchor points, depending on the positions of graph nodes after a layout is applied.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.AnchorPosition
member.summary: Specifies link anchoring relative to the origin or destination node's bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.AnchorPosition.NoAnchor
member.summary: Indicates no anchoring.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.AnchorPosition.HorzCenter
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.AnchorPosition.VertCenter
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.AnchorPosition.LeftCenter
member.summary: Indicates anchoring at the center of the left side of the node's bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.AnchorPosition.RightCenter
member.summary: Indicates anchoring at the center of the right side of the node's bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.AnchorPosition.TopCenter
member.summary: Indicates anchoring at the center of the top side of the node's bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.AnchorPosition.BottomCenter
member.summary: Indicates anchoring at the center of the bottom side of the node's bounding rectangle.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.LinkCrossings
member.summary: Defines values that indicate how to render link intersection points.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.LinkCrossings.Straight
member.summary: No special indication for link intersection points.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.LinkCrossings.Arcs
member.summary: An arc is drawn at the intersection point of two links. It connects the segments of the link at higher Z position and goes over the link at lower Z.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.LinkCrossings.Cut
member.summary: The intersection segments of links at lower Z position are cut by links at higher Z position.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.LinkStyle
member.summary: Specifies available styles for the segments of links.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.LinkStyle.Bezier
member.summary: The segments of an link are Bézier curves.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.LinkStyle.Polyline
member.summary: The segments of the link are straight lines.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.LinkStyle.Cascading
member.summary: The segments of an link are horizontal and vertical lines, each one orthogonal to each adjacent segment.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.LinkTextStyle
member.summary: Specifies the position and alignment of links' labels.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.LinkTextStyle.Center
member.summary: The text is displayed horizontally above the middle link segment or control point, depending on whether there are an odd or even number of segments.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.LinkTextStyle.Rotate
member.summary: The text is displayed rotated at the same angle as the segment where the text is placed. A long enough segment from the middle link segments is chosen for that purpose.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.LinkTextStyle.OverLongestSegment
member.summary: The text follows the longest link segment and is displayed centered at the segment's middle point.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.LinkTextStyle.Follow
member.summary: The label text starts from the first point of the link and follows the path defined by the link segments. This style is useful for displaying long text.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.LinkTextStyle.MiddleSegment
member.summary: The text is displayed horizontally above the middle link segment. If there are an even number of segments, the label is drawn over the longer from the two segments adjacent to the middle control point.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.LinkTextStyle.MiddleSegmentRotated
member.summary: The text is displayed rotated at the same angle as the segment where the text is placed. A long enough segment from the middle link segments is chosen for that purpose.

member.summary: Preserves the absolute distance from a node to link's start or end point.

member.summary: Defines in which directions automatic resizing can enlarge the diagram scrollable area.

member.summary: Do not enlarge the diagram area automatically.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.AutoResize.RightAndDown
member.summary: Enlarge the diagram area to the right and down if an item is moved outside the boundaries in these directions.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Behavior
member.summary: Defines values that specify how the component responds to actions performed by the user.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Behavior.Modify
member.summary: Objects can be selected and modified. New objects cannot be created.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Behavior.DrawShapes
member.summary: Drawing with the mouse creates ShapeNode instances.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Behavior.DrawLinks
member.summary: Drawing started over a node creates a DiagramLink. Otherwise a lasso rectangle is displayed allowing the selection of items.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Behavior.LinkShapes
member.summary: A mode that is suitable for creating flowcharts and process diagrams. Drawing over empty document area creates a ShapeNode instance. Drawing started over a node creates a DiagramLink.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Behavior.LinkTables
member.summary: A mode that is suitable for creating entity-relationship diagrams. Drawing over empty document area creates a TableNode instance. Drawing started over a node creates a DiagramLink.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Behavior.DrawTables
member.summary: Drawing with the mouse creates TableNode instances.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Behavior.DrawControls
member.summary: Drawing with the mouse creates ControlHost instances.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Behavior.LinkControls
member.summary: Drawing over empty document area creates a ControlHost instance. Drawing started over a node creates a DiagramLink.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Behavior.DoNothing
member.summary: The control ignores users actions with the mouse, but raises the appropriate mouse events. This mode allows applications to implement their own mouse-drawing behavior, disabling the MindFusion.Diagramming default response to users actions.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Behavior.Custom
member.summary: Specifies that user input should be handled by the BehaviorBase-derived object assigned to CustomBehavior.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Behavior.DrawContainers
member.summary: Drawing with the mouse creates ContainerNode instances.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Behavior.LinkContainers
member.summary: Drawing over empty document area creates a ContainerNode instance. Drawing started over a node creates a DiagramLink.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Behavior.Pan
member.summary: Dragging with the mouse pans the view.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Behavior.DrawTreeViews
member.summary: Drawing with the mouse creates TreeViewNode instances.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Behavior.LinkTreeViews
member.summary: Drawing over empty document area creates a TreeViewNode instance. Drawing started over a node creates a DiagramLink.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Behavior.DrawSvgNodes
member.summary: Drawing with the mouse creates SvgNode instances.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Behavior.LinkSvgNodes
member.summary: Drawing over empty document area creates an SvgNode instance. Drawing started over a node creates a DiagramLink.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.CustomDraw
member.summary: Specifies what kind of custom painting to perform on diagram elements.
member.remarks: These values can be assigned to the CustomDraw property of shapes, tables and links.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.CustomDraw.None
member.summary: Do not perform custom drawing, let all painting be done by MindFusion.Diagramming.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.CustomDraw.Additional
member.summary: The custom painting code executes after item's interior and frame are painted by MindFusion.Diagramming, but before text is rendered. In this mode, the DrawingContext instance passed to the custom drawing event handler has a clipping region applied to it.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.CustomDraw.Full
member.summary: The component does not do any standard drawing, the entire painting of an item is done by the application.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.CustomDraw.ShadowOnly
member.summary: Only the shadow of an item is painted by custom code, the item itself id drawn by the component.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.CustomDraw.Additional2
member.summary: The custom painting code executes after all parts of an item are painted by MindFusion.Diagramming. In this mode, the DrawingContext instance passed to the custom drawing event handler doesn't have a clipping region applied to it.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.SaveToStringFormat.CompressedXml

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.AdjustmentHandles
member.summary: Identifies the distinct selection handles of a node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.AdjustmentHandles.None
member.summary: Specifies that none of the selection handles can be used to modify the node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.AdjustmentHandles.ResizeTopLeft
member.summary: The top-left handle is enabled and can be used to resize the node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.AdjustmentHandles.ResizeTopRight
member.summary: The top-right handle is enabled and can be used to resize the node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.AdjustmentHandles.ResizeBottomRight
member.summary: The bottom-right handle is enabled and can be used to resize the node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.AdjustmentHandles.ResizeBottomLeft
member.summary: The bottom-left handle is enabled and can be used to resize the node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.AdjustmentHandles.ResizeTopCenter
member.summary: The top-center handle is enabled and can be used to resize the node vertically.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.AdjustmentHandles.ResizeMiddleRight
member.summary: The middle-right handle is enabled and can be used to resize the node horizontally.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.AdjustmentHandles.ResizeBottomCenter
member.summary: The bottom-center handle is enabled and can be used to resize the node vertically.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.AdjustmentHandles.ResizeMiddleLeft
member.summary: The middle-left handle is enabled and can be used to resize the node horizontally.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.AdjustmentHandles.Move
member.summary: The center selection handle is enabled and can be used to move the node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.AdjustmentHandles.Rotate
member.summary: The rotation handle is enabled and can be used to rotate the node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.AdjustmentHandles.All
member.summary: All selection handles areenabled and canbe used to modify the node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.AdjustmentHandles.LeftHandles
member.summary: The top-left, middle-left and bottom-left handles are enabled.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.AdjustmentHandles.RightHandles
member.summary: The top-right, bottom-right and middle-right handles are enabled.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.AdjustmentHandles.TopHandles
member.summary: The top-left, top-center and top-right handles are enabled.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.AdjustmentHandles.BottomHandles
member.summary: The bottom-left, bottom-center and bottom-right handles are enabled.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.HandlesStyle
member.summary: Enumerates possible visual styles for frames that are drawn around selected nodes.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.HandlesStyle.Invisible
member.summary: There is no visible difference between selected and unselected node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.HandlesStyle.SquareHandles
member.summary: If selected, the node is drawn with square modification handles.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.HandlesStyle.DashFrame
member.summary: If selected, a node is drawn with a dashed frame. The frame enables resizing the node. The center of the node allows moving it and the edge area enables creating links.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.HandlesStyle.HatchFrame
member.summary: If selected, the object is drawn with hatched frame. Modifications can be done as with DashFrame.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.HandlesStyle.HatchHandles
member.summary: If selected, a node is drawn with both hatched frame and modification handles. The frame enable moving the node, and the handles enable resizing. Links are created from any point of the interior.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.HandlesStyle.HatchHandles2
member.summary: Looks like HatchHandles, but allows moving the node from the interior area. Links are created from the points near the edge.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.HandlesStyle.HatchHandles3
member.summary: Behaves like HatchHandles2, but paints the selection frame using a denser brush pattern.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.HandlesStyle.MoveOnly
member.summary: If a node is selected, it can be only moved. Best used with ModificationStart set to AutoHandles.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.HandlesStyle.EasyMove
member.summary: Any point of the interior of a node enables moving the node, except a small area in the center that allows creating links. Best used with ModificationStart set to AutoHandles.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.HandlesStyle.SquareHandles2
member.summary: Square resize handles are drawn around a selected node. There isn't a move-handle in the center as with the SquareHandles style, but nodes can be moved by dragging their interior or caption areas. Links can be created by drawing from near the edges of a node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.HandlesStyle.Custom
member.summary: MindFusion.Diagramming raises the DrawHandles and HitTestAdjustmentHandles events to let your application perform custom drawing and hit testing of selection handles.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.HandlesStyle.InvisibleMove
member.summary: There aren't any selection handles displayed. The selected node can be only moved, but not resized.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.HitTestPriority
member.summary: Defines values that specify the order of item hit-testing.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.HitTestPriority.ZOrder
member.summary: Test items in decreasing z-order, independently of their types.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.HitTestPriority.NodesBeforeLinks
member.summary: Test nodes first, then links.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.ControlMouseAction
member.summary: Specifies available ways to handle mouse clicks on .NET controls hosted in a ControlNode.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.ControlMouseAction.PassToControl
member.summary: Let the control handle the mouse click. Do not select the host node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.ControlMouseAction.SelectNode
member.summary: The host node gets selected when the control is clicked. The control is left to handle the mouse click too.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.ControlMouseAction.IgnoreControl
member.summary: MindFusion.Diagramming tries to intercept the mouse message and not pass it to the control. That allows drawing links from anywhere within the control.

member.summary: No visual indication for the anchor point.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.MarkStyle.Cross
member.summary: No visual indication for the anchor point.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.MarkStyle.X
member.summary: Anchor point marked with an 'X'.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.MarkStyle.Circle
member.summary: Anchor point marked with a circle.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.MarkStyle.Rectangle
member.summary: Anchor point marked with a rectangle.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.MarkStyle.Custom
member.summary: A DrawAnchorPoint event is fired, allowing custom painting of anchor points.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.ModificationStart
member.summary: Specifies how the user can start modifying an item.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.ModificationStart.SelectedOnly
member.summary: Only selected objects can be modified.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.ModificationStart.AutoHandles
member.summary: Adjustment handles appear automatically around the object under the mouse; it can be modified without selecting it first.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.ModifierKeyAction
member.summary: Defines the actions that can be assigned to a modifier key such as CTRL or ALT.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.ModifierKeyAction.None
member.summary: Specifies that a modifier key does not have any specific function assigned to it.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.ModifierKeyAction.Pan
member.summary: Pan the view if the mouse is dragged while the modifier key is pressed down.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.ModifierKeyAction.Select
member.summary: Start drawing a selection rectangle if the mouse is dragged while a modifier key is pressed down. Toggle the selection if an item is clicked while the key is down.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.ModifierKeyAction.OverrideBehavior
member.summary: While the modifier key is pressed down, dragging the mouse starts creating a new item or drawing a selection rectangle instead of modifying a selected item. Otherwise, dragging the mouse could start modification of the selected item.

member.summary: Do not reroute links automatically.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.RerouteLinks.WhileModifying

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Commands.CompositeCmd
member.summary: Represents a set of Command instances as a single operation. Undoing or redoing the composite action, respectively undoes or redoes all its constituent subactions at the same time.
member.remarks: To add a subaction to the composite call the AddSubCmd method. The Execute method executes all subactions and adds the composite to undo manager's history.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Commands.CompositeCmd.#ctor(MindFusion.Diagramming.Diagram,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the CompositeCmd class.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Commands.CompositeCmd.#ctor(MindFusion.Diagramming.Diagram,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the CompositeCmd class.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Commands.CompositeCmd.Execute
member.summary: Executes the command, adding it to the command history.
member.remarks: Subcommands are executed or redone in the same order in which they were added to the composite, and are undone in the opposite order.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Commands.CompositeCmd.Execute(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Carries out the command action.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Commands.CompositeCmd.Undo
member.summary: Undoes the command.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Commands.CompositeCmd.Redo
member.summary: Redoes the command action.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Commands.CompositeCmd.SubCommands
member.summary: Gets a collection of all command objects contained within the composite one.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.CommandHistory
member.summary: Maintains a queue of Command records used to undo or redo actions.
member.remarks: The only instance of CommandHistory can be accessed via the History property of UndoManager.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.CommandHistory.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the CommandHistory class.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.CommandHistory.MergeUndoRecords(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Merges several undo records into a single composite record.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.CommandHistory.SaveCommand(MindFusion.Diagramming.Commands.Command,MindFusion.Diagramming.Diagram)
member.summary: Adds the specified command to the command history.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.CommandHistory.Clear
member.summary: Removes all records from the history queue.
member.remarks: Call Clear to remove all action records that are currently in the history queue, making those actions unavailable for undo or redo anymore.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.CommandHistory.Undo
member.summary: Performs undo on the current command in the history, adjusting the current command pointer.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.CommandHistory.Redo
member.summary: Performs redo in the next command in the history, adjusting the current command pointer.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.CommandHistory.NextUndo
member.summary: Gets a reference to the command that would be undone if Undo is invoked.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.CommandHistory.NextRedo
member.summary: Gets a reference to the command that would be redone if Redo is invoked.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.CommandHistory.Capacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of records to keep in the history queue.
member.remarks: If the history queue is full, the oldest command records are removed from the beginning when new ones are added.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.CommandHistory.Commands
member.summary: Gets the commands saved in the undo / redo history queue.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.AnchorPoint.X
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal position of the anchor point expressed as percent of a node's width.
member.remarks: Set the property value to a number from 0 to 100, otherwise you might get unexpected behavior.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.AnchorPoint.Y
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical position of the anchor point expressed as percent of a node's height.
member.remarks: Set the property value to a number from 0 to 100, otherwise you might get unexpected behavior.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.AnchorPoint.Column
member.summary: Gets or sets the column index of a cell with which the anchor point is associated.
member.remarks: If Column is set to -1, the point relative coordinates specify percents of row's extents. Otherwise the point coordinates specify percents of cell's extents.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.AnchorPoint.AllowIncoming
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether incoming links can be connected to this anchor.
member.remarks: If no incoming anchors are defined for a node, links end points can be placed anywhere inside that node, unless AllowUnanchoredLinks is disabled.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.AnchorPoint.AllowOutgoing
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the anchor point accepts outgoing connections.
member.remarks: If no outgoing anchors are defined for a node, links start points can be placed anywhere inside that node, unless AllowUnanchoredLinks is disabled.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.AnchorPoint.MarkStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the appearance of the anchor point mark.
member.remarks: Specifies how anchor points are marked visually on the display.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.AnchorPoint.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the anchor point mark.
member.remarks: The anchor mark shape specified via MarkStyle is painted with this color.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.AnchorPoint.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets a user-defined data associated with the anchor point.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.AnchorPoint.ToolTip
member.summary: Gets or sets a tooltip text that should be displayed when the mouse hovers over an anchor point mark.
member.remarks: When the mouse rests for a while over an anchor point, the tool-tip text is displayed in a small popup window near the mouse cursor.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLinkState
member.summary: Contains a snapshot of the internal state of a DiagramLink. Instances of this class are used to store the state of links for later undo or redo operations. If you derive from DiagramLink and need to implement undo support for the additional internal state defined by your class, do so by deriving from DiagramLinkState and overriding the DiagramLink.CreateState, DiagramLink.SaveState and DiagramLink.RestoreState methods.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLinkProperties
member.summary: Stores the values of DiagramLink properties during undo / redo operations. If you need to implement undo support for the additional properties defined by a class derived from DiagramLink, do so by deriving from DiagramLinkProperties and overriding the DiagramLink.SaveProperties, DiagramLink.RestoreProperties, and DiagramLink.CreateProperties methods.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Diagram.ValidityChecks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether validity checks are performed each time an item is added to the diagram. That involves enumerating the item collections and can slow up the process considerably for large diagrams. Disable this property to skip the checks, however be sure that you don't add an item twice to the diagram and that links are created only between items in the same diagram.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Layout.CascadeLayout
member.summary: Performs cascading layout on simple, connected graphs.
member.remarks: The cascade layout places vertices on a virtual grid and arranges edges orthogonally, such that if the source graph is planar it is guaranteed that all edges will have no more than two bends and will not intersect.

member.summary: Implements undo/redo functionality in MindFusion.Diagramming.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the UndoManager class.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.UndoManager.Undo
member.summary: Undoes an action saved in the command history.
member.remarks: Undoes a command from the command history. The action that would be undone by calling this method is pointed by NextUndo property of the CommandHistory class.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.UndoManager.Redo
member.summary: Executes again an action saved in the command history.
member.remarks: Executes again a command from the command history. The action that would be redone by calling this method is pointed by NextRedo property of the CommandHistory class.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.UndoManager.StartComposite(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an 'active' composite record with the specified title.
member.param: A string to be associated with the composite record. It can be used later to give more information to users what exactly will be undone or redone. Use the Title property of the command class to get the title of an action record.
member.returns: An instance of the CompositeCmd class which represents the active composite record. Call its Execute method when done with recording actions in the composite.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.UndoManager.StartComposite(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an 'active' composite record with the specified settings.
member.param: A string to be associated with the composite record. It can be used later to give more information to users what exactly will be undone or redone. Use the Title property of the command class to get the title of an action record.

Set this parameter to true to save the whole z-order array before executing the composite command, and to restore it back when the command is undone. Use that when there will be create or delete commands added to the composite one, because they do not guarantee restoring the items in the same z-order when the commands are undone or redone.
member.returns: An instance of the CompositeCmd class which represents the active composite record. Call its Execute method when done with recording actions in the composite.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.Layout.MultipleGraphsPlacement
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how multiple independent graphs in the diagram should be positioned relatively to each other.
member.value: A member of the MultipleGraphsPlacement enumeration. The default value is Horizontal.
member.remarks: If the diagram contains several unconnected subgraphs, each of them is processed by the algorithm independently from the others. This property specifies how such subgraphs should be placed one relatively to another. The possible options are to arrange them in a row, in a column, or in such a way that the diagram covers a minimal area.

member.summary: Gets the default value for the Margins property, which may vary accross different layouts.

member.summary: Gets or sets how much space to leave between levels of the tree.
member.value: A real number specifying the distance between adjacent levels in the tree. The default value is 10.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.TreeLayout.NodeDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets how much space to leave between nodes on the same level.
member.value: A real number specifying the distance between adjacent nodes. The default value is 10.
member.remarks: This property is ignored if Type is set to Radial.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.TreeLayout.StretchFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the stretch factor applied on Radial tree layouts.
member.value: A real number specifying the ratio between the horizontal and vertical radii of radial layout outlines. The default is 1.
member.remarks: When applying a radial layout, node layers are laid out in concentric circles around the Root node. Stretching them by changing this property makes layers laid out in elliptic outlines.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.TreeLayout.Direction
member.summary: Gets or sets the tree direction.
member.value: A member of the TreeLayoutDirection.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.TreeLayout.ReversedLinks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the link direction that relates parent nodes to child nodes.
member.value: true to indicate reversed direction, that is, the parent node is the one the link points to; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.TreeLayout.IgnoreLinkDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the tree layout algorithm should ignore the direction of links when arranging a tree.
member.value: true to ignore link direction; otherwise, false. The default is false.
member.remarks: Parent-child direction is considered the one in which nodes go further from the root, instead that of the links. If IgnoreLinkDirection is set to true, you must explicitly specify the tree Root.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.TreeLayout.Balance
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the ordering of the child nodes in order to produce layouts with custom balance.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.TreeLayout.EnableAssistants
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the "assistant" trait is regarded when performing the layout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.TreeLayout.CompactAssistants
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the "assistant" nodes on the same side of a single parent are arranged as close enough to each other as possible. Turning this off will force the nodes on one side to be aligned with their counterparts in the other and occasionally leaving space between adjacent branches.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.AnnealLayout
member.summary: Implements a simulated annealing graph layout algorithm.
member.remarks: Simulated Annealing is a general-purpose optimization method used to solve large-scale combinatorial problems by simulating the process of heating and cooling of metal to achieve freedom from defects. Finding a nice arrangement of a graph is a combinatorial problem that can be reduced to assigning costs to graph configurations and finding the minimum cost configuration. In that case, a cost is assigned to a graph configuration by evaluating different aesthetic criteria such as distance between nodes, length of links and the number of link crossings.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.AnnealLayout.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the AnnealLayout class.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.AnnealLayout.BeginArrange(MindFusion.Diagramming.Diagram,MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramItemCollection)
member.summary: Initializes the layout object for a step-by-step execution.
member.param: The Diagram that will be arranged.
A collection of nodes and links from diagram that define the subgraph to arrange.
member.returns: true if the layout object has been initialized successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.AnnealLayout.Iterate(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Runs one or more layout iterations.
member.param: Specifies from which iteration to start.
Specifies at which iteration to stop.
member.remarks: Use this method to create an animation of the layout process, for example, by calling it from a timer. Call BeginArrange to prepare the layout object for use of Iterate, and call EndArrange when done. Each call to Iterate starts from the iteration next to the one where the previous call has stopped.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.AnnealLayout.EndArrange
member.summary: Completes the step-by-step execution.
