member.summary: Applies the layout to the specified subset of items from the specified Diagram instance.
member.param: The Diagram that should be arranged.
A collection of nodes and links from diagram that define the subgraph to arrange.
member.returns: This method always returns true.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.AnnealLayout.Name
member.summary: Gets a user-friendly name of the layout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.AnnealLayout.DefaultMarginValue
member.summary: Gets the default value of the Margins property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.AnnealLayout.Root
member.summary: Gets or sets a node indicating which subgraph of the diagram should be laid out.
member.value: A DiagramNode whose containing graph should be arranged. The default is null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
member.remarks: If a root nodes is specified and SplitGraph is enabled, only the graph that contains the root node is laid out by Arrange.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.AnnealLayout.DistributionFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the importance of the node distribution, relative to the other criteria considered by the algorithm.
member.value: A double multiplier applied to the node distribution cost when evaluating the total cost of a graph configuration. The default is 40000.
member.remarks: Assigning a larger value to this property will make the algorithm choose graph configurations in which the nodes are placed farther one from another.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.AnnealLayout.BoundaryFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the importance of the distance between nodes and the layout area boundaries, relative to the other criteria considered by the algorithm.
member.value: A double multiplier applied to the node-to-boundary distance cost when evaluating the total cost of a graph configuration. The default is 3000.
member.remarks: Assigning a larger value to this property will make the algorithm choose graph configurations in which nodes are placed farther from the layout area bounds, that is, nodes will tend to gather in the center of the layout area.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.AnnealLayout.LinkLengthFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the importance of the short length of links, relative to the other criteria considered by the algorithm.
member.value: A double multiplier applied to the link length cost when evaluating the total cost of a graph configuration. The default is 0.25.
member.remarks: Assigning a larger value to this property will make the algorithm choose graph configurations in which links are shorter.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.AnnealLayout.CrossingLinksCost
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the importance of the low number of link crossings, relative to the other criteria considered by the algorithm.
member.value: A double value added to the total cost of a graph configuration for each pair of crossing links. The default is 120000.
member.remarks: Assigning a larger value to this property will make the algorithm choose graph configurations with fewer link crossings.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.AnnealLayout.NodeLinkCrossingCost
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the importance of low number of overlaps between links and nodes relative to the other criteria considered by the algorithm.
member.value: A double value added to the total cost of a graph configuration when a link crosses a node. The default is 15000.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.AnnealLayout.NodeLinkDistFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the importance of the distance between nodes and links, relative to the other criteria considered by the algorithm.
member.value: A double value specifying the distance factor. The default value is 20000.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.AnnealLayout.InitialTemperature
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial temperature of the simulated annealing process.
member.value: A double value specifying the initial temperature of the simulation. The default is 40.
member.remarks: A low initial temperature prevents nodes from moving far from their initial position.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.AnnealLayout.TemperatureScale
member.summary: Gets or sets how much the simulated temperature is decreased at each stage of the algorithm.
member.value: A double multiplier applied to the simulated temperature at each stage of the algorithm. The default is 0.75.
member.remarks: This value should be in the interval (0, 1). The algorithm produces better results when running for many Stages with a gradual temperature decrease, that is, a TemperatureScale closer to 1.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.AnnealLayout.IterationsPerStage
member.summary: Gets or sets how many node shift iterations to perform at each stage of the algorithm.
member.value: An integer value specifying the number of node shift iterations. The default is 50.
member.remarks: IterationsPerStage specifies how many node configurations to evaluate at each stage of the temperature cool-down simulation.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.AnnealLayout.Stages
member.summary: Gets or sets how many cool-down stages the algorithm should simulate.
member.value: An integer value specifying the number of temperature decreases the simulation should run. The default is 15.
member.remarks: At each stage the algorithm evaluates different graph arrangements produced by modifying the best configuration from the previous stage.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.AnnealLayout.ApproximateLinkLength
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the layout should approximate the length of graph links by calculating the distance between the centers of their incident nodes.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.AnnealLayout.LayoutArea
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the layout area.
member.value: A System.Windows.Rect structure representing the boundaries of the layout area. The default is Rect.Empty.
member.remarks: If the layout area is not explicitly set, the algorithm will choose one suitable for the graph size.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.AnnealLayout.WidthHeightRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets what width/height ratio the layout area should have.
member.value: A real number specifying the layout area width to height ratio. The default is 1.
member.remarks: If the LayoutArea is not explicitly set, the algorithm will choose one suitable for the graph size. In that case the WidthHeightRatio property specifies how much larger the layout area width should be than its height.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.AnnealLayout.Randomize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the nodes should be placed at random positions when the layout routine starts.
member.value: true to start the simulation with random node positions; false to start it with the original node positions. The default is true.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.AnnealLayout.SplitGraph
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether unconnected subgraphs should be laid out independently from each other.
member.value: true if unconnected graphs in the diagram should be laid out independently; otherwise, false. The default is false.
member.remarks: If this property is set to true, each independent graph in the diagram is laid out in its own layout area. Otherwise all subgraphs are arranged in the same layout area.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.AnnealLayout.Statistics
member.summary: Returns statistics about the layout execution and end results.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.AnnealLayout.GatherStatistics
member.summary: Specifies whether the layout should gather statistics while running.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.SpringLayout
member.summary: Implements the Spring-Embedder graph layout algorithm.
member.remarks: Spring-Embedder produces layouts having uniform distribution of nodes by simulating a physical system in which nodes repulse each other and the links between them act as confining springs. Nodes are moved around in an iterative process. The forces that act on a node are calculated, taking in account the positions of surrounding nodes and links from the previous iteration.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SpringLayout class with the default settings.

The distance between nodes.
Specifies whether to try to minimize crossings while layouting.

The distance between nodes.

Specifies whether to keep the relative position of grouped items.

member.summary: Gets a user-friendly name of the layout.

member.summary: Gets the default value of the Margins property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.SpringLayout.Stretch
member.summary: Gets or sets the link stretch factor.
member.value: A double value specifying the stretch factor used by the spring layout.

member.summary: Gets or sets for how many iterations to run the layout routine.
member.value: An integer number specifying the number of iterations.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.SpringLayout.NodeDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired distance between nodes.
member.value: A real number specifying the distance between nodes. The default is 30.
member.remarks: The final distance between connected nodes is determined by multiplying the Weight of the link that connects them by the value of NodeDistance.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.SpringLayout.MinimizeCrossings
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether crossing minimization mode is enabled.
member.value: true to attempt crossing minimization; otherwise, false. The default is true.
member.remarks: If enabled, the algorithm tries to decrease number of crossing links. For better results, use greater IterationCount.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.SpringLayout.EnableClusters
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable allocation of nodes to distinct clusters.
member.value: true to detect and process node clusters; otherwise, false. The default is false.
member.remarks: If enabled, the SpringLayout algorithm detects node clusters and places them at distinct positions. Each cluster consists of a center node surrounded by several local nodes. Clusters might be connected with other clusters via their center nodes. Best-looking results are achieved when there aren't links between the local nodes in a cluster.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.SpringLayout.SplitGraph
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to split the graph to its interconnected subgraphs and arrange the subgraphs independently or arrange the graph as a whole.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.SpringLayout.RepulsionFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the multiplier applied to repulsion forces between nodes.
member.value: A double value specifying the repulsion factor used by the spring layout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.SpringLayout.RandomSeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the randomization seed to use for generating random node positions.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.SpringLayout.Randomize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether nodes should be placed at random positions when the layout routine starts.
member.value: true to start the simulation with random node positions; false to start it with the original node positions. The default is false.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.LayeredLayout.Arrange(MindFusion.Diagramming.Diagram,MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramItemCollection)
member.summary: Applies the layout to the specified subset of items from the specified Diagram instance.
member.param: The Diagram that should be arranged.
A collection of nodes and links from diagram that define the subgraph to arrange.
member.returns: This method always returns true.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.LayeredLayout.Name
member.summary: Gets a user-friendly name of the layout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.LayeredLayout.DefaultMarginValue
member.summary: Gets the default value of the Margins property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.LayeredLayout.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the overall orientation of the arranged diagram.
member.value: A member of the Orientation enumeration. The default is Vertical.
member.remarks: Specify Orientation.Vertical to have links flow in vertical direction and Orientation.Horizontal to have links flow in horizontal direction. The orientation of the resulting layers is opposite to that of the links. Thus, if the link tends to go in a vertical direction, the nodes are distributed in horizontal layers.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.LayeredLayout.Direction
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction of the arranged diagram.
member.value: A member of the Direction enumeration. The default is Straight.
member.remarks: If Orientation is set to Horizontal, Direction.Straight stands for "left to right" and Direction.Reversed for "right to left". If Orientation is set to Vertical, Direction.Straight stands for "top to bottom" and Direction.Reversed for "bottom to top".

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.LayeredLayout.LayerDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired distance between layer axis lines.
member.value: A real number specifying the distance between layers.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.LayeredLayout.NodeDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired distance between adjacent nodes in a layer.
member.value: A real number specifying the distance between adjacent nodes.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.LayeredLayout.SplitLayers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to split layers that are much wider than the other layers.
member.value: true to split wide layers; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.LayeredLayout.LinksCompactFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how much to compact the outermost arrows.
member.value: A real number in the interval [0, 1]. The default is 1.
member.remarks: Links and nodes on the same graph layer are distributed uniformly as specified by the NodeDistance value. However, if there are more than 2-3 outermost links on a layer, they usually take up too much space without improving the visual quality of the diagram layout. This property allows compacting such links to save space. The factor specifies roughly a fraction of NodeDistance to leave between outer links.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.LayeredLayout.TimeLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets a time-out value for the path-finding part of the layered layout algorithm.
member.value: An integer value specifying time-out in milliseconds. The default is 10000 (10 seconds).
member.remarks: The layered layout algorithm arranges graph nodes and links along the longest path in the graph. Large graphs with many links could contain hundreds of thousands of possible paths, so finding the longest one would be very time-consuming. When the time-out set with this property occurs, the path-finding routine stops and the layout algorithm uses the longest path known at that moment. Usually, for graphs containing several hundreds of nodes, 1-2 seconds are enough to find a long-enough path to produce nice layered layout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.LayeredLayout.SwapPairsIterations
member.summary: Gets or sets how many times to perform pair-swapping iterations on each layer.
member.value: An integer value specifying how many pair-swapping iterations to perform. The default is 5.
member.remarks: The algorithm swaps node pairs on each layer aiming to decrease the number of crossing links. Setting a higher value to this property helps to decrease the number of crossings.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.LayeredLayout.Root
member.summary: Gets or sets a node indicating which subgraph of the diagram must be laid out.
member.value: An instance of the DiagramNode class. The default is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
member.remarks: All links and nodes that can be reached from the root by following recursively its links form a graph. If the root is specified, only the graph containing it is laid out by Arrange.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.LayeredLayout.IgnoreNodeSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the distance between adjacent nodes in the final layout should be independent of the nodes' size.
member.value: true to ignore the node size; otherwise, false. The default is true.
member.remarks: At this time, considering the size of nodes deteriorates the performance of the algorithm, so that's disabled by default.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.LayeredLayout.EnableCustomLayers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to indicating whether the layered layout will honor the LayeredLayoutTraits.Layer flags.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.LayeredLayout.LinkType
member.summary: Gets or sets the appearance of the links in the final layout.
member.value: A member of the LayeredLayoutLinkType enumeration. The default is Straight.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.LayeredLayout.Statistics
member.summary: Gets layout-specific information about the nodes and links participating in the layout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.LayeredLayout.KeepRootPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to preserve the position of the root node.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.LayeredLayout.EnforceLinkFlow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to attempt to force all links to go in the same direction. If the graph being arrange has cycles, some of the links will still go backward.
member.remarks: EnableCustomLayers and SplitLayers are ignored if this property is set to true.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.LayeredLayout.StraightenLongLinks
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the layout algorithm should strive to straighten links that cross more than one layer of the graph.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.OrthogonalLayout
member.summary: Implements an orthogonal graph layout algorithm. Each link is drawn as a chain of alternating horizontal and vertical segments. Nodes are placed in a way that facilitates few links bends and crossings.

member.param: The Diagram that should be arranged.
A collection of nodes and links from diagram that define the subgraph to arrange.
member.returns: This method always returns true.

member.summary: Gets a user-friendly name of the layout.

member.summary: Gets the default value of the Margins property.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.TriangularLayout
member.summary: Performs triangular layout on simple, connected graphs.
member.remarks: The triangular layout places vertices on a virtual grid, such that if the source graph is planar is guaranteed that all links will have a single segment and will not intersect. If the graph is not planar, the intersecting links are optionally segmented and bended in order to improve readability.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TriangularLayout class.

member.summary: Layout.BuildGraph override.

member.summary: Applies the layout to the specified subset of items from the specified Diagram instance.
member.param: The Diagram that should be arranged.
A collection of nodes and links from diagram that define the subgraph to arrange.
member.returns: This method always returns true.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.TriangularLayout.Name
member.summary: Gets a user-friendly name of the layout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.TriangularLayout.DefaultMarginValue
member.summary: Gets the default value of the Margins property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.TriangularLayout.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets a the orientation of the arranged graph.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.TriangularLayout.BendNonplanarLinks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the intersecting links in a non-planar graphs will be segmented and bended to improve presentation.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.TriangularLayout.GridSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the virtual grid the layout will place vertices on.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.CascadeLayout
member.summary: Performs cascading layout on simple, connected graphs.
member.remarks: The cascade layout places vertices on a virtual grid and arranges edges orthogonally, such that if the source graph is planar it is guaranteed that all edges will have no more than two bends and will not intersect.

member.param: The Diagram that should be arranged.
A collection of nodes and links from diagram that define the subgraph to arrange.
member.returns: This method always returns true.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.HierarchicalLayout
member.summary: Performs hierarchical layout on simple, connected, level-planar graphs.
member.remarks: The hierarchical layout places vertices on predefined levels, such that if the source graph is level-planar it is guaranteed that all edges will have a single segment and will not intersect. A planar graph is considered level-planar if it is still possible to draw it without edge intersections when its vertices are positioned on predefined levels.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.HierarchicalLayout.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the HierarchicalLayout class.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.HierarchicalLayout.BuildGraph(MindFusion.Diagramming.Diagram,MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramItemCollection)
member.summary: Layout.BuildGraph override.

member.summary: Applies the layout to the specified subset of items from the specified Diagram instance.
member.param: The Diagram that should be arranged.
A collection of nodes and links from diagram that define the subgraph to arrange.
member.returns: false, if there is a node in the graph without assigned level; otherwise, true.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.HierarchicalLayout.Name
member.summary: Gets a user-friendly name of the layout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.HierarchicalLayout.DefaultMarginValue
member.summary: Gets the default value of the Margins property.

member.summary: Gets or sets a the orientation of the arranged graph.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.HierarchicalLayout.LevelDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between adjacent levels in the hierarchical layout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.HierarchicalLayout.LinkBendFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the bending factor of links.
member.remarks: A value of 1 indicates that the links should not bend. A value less than 1 indicates that the links should bend towards the geometric center of the graph. A value greater than 1 indicates that the links should bend outwards.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.CircularLayout
member.summary: Implements a circular graph layout algorithm. Nodes are distributed evenly on the circumference of a circle at positions that result in as few link crossing as possible.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the CircularLayout class with the default settings.

member.summary: Layout.BuildGraph override.

member.summary: Applies the layout to the specified subset of items from the specified Diagram instance.
member.param: The Diagram that should be arranged.
A collection of nodes and links from diagram that define the subgraph to arrange.
member.returns: This method always returns true.

member.summary: Gets a user-friendly name of the layout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.CircularLayout.DefaultMarginValue
member.summary: Gets the default value of the Margins property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.CircularLayout.Radius
member.summary: Gets or sets the radius of the layout circle.
member.remarks: If this property is set to 0, the layout will try to find an appropriate radius depending on the number and size of the participating nodes.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.CircularLayout.SiftingRounds
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of sifts to perform during the layout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.CircularLayout.AutoRadiusFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets a multiplier for the automatically calculated radius when Radius is set to 0.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.GridLayout
member.summary: Implements a grid graph layout algorithm.
member.remarks: GridLayout arranges diagram nodes in a grid, keeping connected nodes close together. The algorithm strives to achieve a small number of link crossings. It is based on an iterative process whose initial steps shuffle the grid nodes randomly. That can lead to very different results each time the algorithm is run.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.GridLayout.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the GridLayout class.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.GridLayout.Arrange(MindFusion.Diagramming.Diagram,MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramItemCollection)
member.summary: Applies the layout to a subgraph of the specified Diagram instance.
member.param: The Diagram that should be arranged.
A collection of nodes and links from diagram that define the subgraph to arrange.
member.returns: true if the layout is successfully applied; false if StartNode and EndNode are specified and there is no path between them.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.GridLayout.Name
member.summary: Gets a user-friendly name of the layout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.GridLayout.DefaultMarginValue
member.summary: Gets the default value of the Margins property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.GridLayout.StartNode
member.summary: Gets or sets the node that is placed at the upper left corner of the grid.
member.value: An instance of the DiagramNode class. The default is null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
member.remarks: If you assign a node to that property, then EndNode cannot be null and must be set too. GridLayout usually produces better layouts if both StartNode and EndNode are null references; in such a case the algorithm automatically selects suitable nodes.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.GridLayout.EndNode
member.summary: Gets or sets the node that is placed at the lower right corner of the grid.
member.value: An instance of the DiagramNode class. Default value is null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
member.remarks: If you assign a node to that property, then StartNode cannot be null and must be set too. GridLayout usually produces better layouts if both StartNode and EndNode are null references; in such a case the algorithm automatically selects suitable nodes.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.GridLayout.Iterations
member.summary: Gets or sets for how many iterations to run the grid layout algorithm.
member.value: An integer number specifying the number of iterations. The default is 3000.
member.remarks: More iterations would yield better layouts but require more time to complete.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.GridLayout.GridSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired distance between adjacent grid points.
member.value: A real number specifying the grid size. The default is 25.
member.remarks: When placing a node at a grid position, the node center point is aligned to the grid point at that position.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.GridLayout.RandomSeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the randomization seed to use for generating random node positions.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.GridLayout.SplitGraph
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to split the graph to its interconnected subgraphs and arrange the subgraphs independently or arrange the graph as a whole.
member.value: true to split the graph; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.GridLayout.Root
member.summary: Gets or sets a node indicating which subgraph of the diagram should be laid out.
member.value: An instance of the DiagramNode class. The default is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
member.remarks: All links and nodes that can be reached from the root by following recursively its links form a graph. If the root is specified, only the graph which it defines is laid out by Arrange.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.GridLayout.UseLongestPath
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the algorithm should arrange nodes around the longest path in the graph.
member.value: true to look for the longest path in the graph and arrange nodes around it; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Initially, the algorithm places nodes and links from the longest path in the graph at the grid diagonal, and arranges the rest of the nodes around the diagonal. Large graphs with many links could contain hundreds of thousands of possible paths, so finding the longest one would be very time-consuming. Disabling this property will let you skip the path-finding part of the algorithm, which will make it work much faster.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.GridLayout.TimeLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets a time-out value for the path-finding part of the grid layout algorithm.
member.value: An integer value specifying time-out in milliseconds. The default is 10000 (10 seconds).
member.remarks: The grid layout algorithm arranges graph nodes and links along the longest path in the graph. Large graphs with many links could contain hundreds of thousands of possible paths, so finding the longest one would be very time-consuming. When the time-out set with this property occurs, the path-finding routine stops and the layout algorithm uses the longest path known at that moment. Usually, for graphs containing several hundreds of nodes, 1-2 seconds are enough to find a path long enough to produce a nice layout.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.OrthogonalRouter
member.summary: Implements an orthogonal link routing algorithm.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.OrthogonalRouter.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the OrthogonalRouter class.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.OrthogonalRouter.Arrange(MindFusion.Diagramming.Diagram,MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramItemCollection)
member.summary: Applies the layout to the specified subset of items from the specified Diagram instance.
member.param: The Diagram that should be arranged.
A collection of nodes and links from diagram that define the subgraph to arrange.
member.returns: This method always returns true.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.OrthogonalRouter.Name
member.summary: Gets a user-friendly name of the layout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.OrthogonalRouter.DefaultMarginValue
member.summary: Gets the default value of the Margins property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.OrthogonalRouter.BendDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets how far from its adjacent node a link should bend.
member.value: A real number specifying the distance from a link's first bend to its adjacent node. The default is 0, specifying that the algorithm should automatically choose a value for this parameter.
member.remarks: This should be a value between 0 and 1, specifying a distance proportional to the node size.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.OrthogonalRouter.GridSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between adjacent grid points when BaseLayout is set to Grid.
member.value: A real number specifying the grid size. The default is 100.
member.remarks: This value is assigned to the GridSize property of the base GridLayout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.OrthogonalRouter.RandomSeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the randomization seed to use for generating random node positions.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.OrthogonalRouter.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the overall orientation of the arranged diagram when BaseLayout is set to Layered.
member.value: An instance of the Orientation enumeration. The default is Vertical.
member.remarks: This value is assigned to the Orientation property of the base LayeredLayout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.OrthogonalRouter.Direction
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction of the arranged diagram when BaseLayout is set to Layered.
member.value: A member of the Direction enumeration. The default is Straight.
member.remarks: This value is assigned to the Direction property of the base LayeredLayout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.OrthogonalRouter.LayerDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired distance between layer axis lines.
member.value: A real number specifying the distance between layers. The default is 25.
member.remarks: Gets or sets the distance between layers when BaseLayout is set to Layered or Cascading.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.OrthogonalRouter.NodeDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired distance between adjacent nodes in a layer.
member.value: A real number specifying the distance between adjacent nodes. The default is 20.
member.remarks: Gets or sets the distance between nodes in the same layer when BaseLayout is set to Layered or Cascading.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.OrthogonalRouter.PutEndPointsAtNodeBorders
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the end points of a link should be placed at the outlines of the nodes connected by that link.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.OrthogonalRouter.StartOrientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired orientation of the first segments of routed links.
member.value: A member of the Orientation enumeration. The default value is Auto.
member.remarks: If this property is set to Horizontal, links will end at the left or right sides of nodes. If set to Vertical, links will end at the top or bottom sides.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.OrthogonalRouter.EndOrientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired orientation of the last segments of routed links.
member.value: A member of the Orientation enumeration. The default value is Auto.
member.remarks: If this property is set to Horizontal, links will end at the left or right sides of nodes. If set to Vertical, links will end at the top or bottom sides.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.FlowLayout.AddNode(MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode,MindFusion.Diagramming.Diagram)
member.summary: Adds the specified node to the already arranged diagram.
member.param: A DiagramNode instance.
A Diagram instance.
member.returns: true if the node has been added successfully; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: You can use AddNode to implement incremental layout of a diagram, for example, by adding new nodes drawn by the user or added via a context menu command. For this method to work correctly, RecreateGraph must be disabled.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.FlowLayout.RemoveNode(MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode,MindFusion.Diagramming.Diagram)
member.summary: Removes the specified node from an existing diagram.
member.param: The DiagramNode to remove.
An already arranged Diagram.
member.returns: true if the node has been removed successfully; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: You can use RemoveNode to implement incremental layout of a diagram, for example, by removing nodes deleted by the user or removed via a context menu command. For this method to work correctly, RecreateGraph must be disabled.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.FlowLayout.InsertNode(MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramNode,MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramLink,MindFusion.Diagramming.Diagram)
member.summary: Inserts the specified node between two nodes connected by the by specified link.
member.param: The DiagramNode to insert.
The DiagramLink to split.
A Diagram instance.
member.returns: true if the node has been added successfully; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: You can use InsertNode to implement incremental layout of a diagram, for example, by adding new nodes drawn by the user or added via a context menu command. For this method to work correctly, RecreateGraph must be disabled.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.FlowLayout.BendLinks(MindFusion.Diagramming.Diagram)
member.summary: Bends all links in an already arranged diagram.
member.param: A Diagram instance.
member.remarks: You can use BendLinks to implement incremental layout of a diagram, for example, by calling it after the user draws a new link, or after several new links are added programmatically. For this method to work correctly, RecreateGraph must be disabled.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the cut-vertices of tree subgraphs are added to the corresponding trees.

member.summary: Gets or sets a layout that should be applied to subgraphs representing trees.

member.summary: Gets or sets a layout that should be applied to general subgraphs.

member.summary: Gets or sets a custom layout that should be applied to subgraphs.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.CompositeLayout.RotateSubgraphs
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether subgraphs are rotated to minimize intersections with cross-partition links.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.CompositeLayout.CustomPartition
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom partition to use when PartitionMethod is set to Custom.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.CompositeLayout.KeepVirtualItems
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to keep the intermediate virtual nodes and links.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.CompositeLayout.UseAdditionalPartitioning
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use an additional partitioning pass on the result of the initial partitioning. This additional partitioning is simplified - it only looks for trees with depth 2.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.CompositeLayout.BendLinks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the links in the trees from the additional partitioning pass will bend to avoid crossing leaves in the same tree.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.FractalLayout
member.summary: A tree layout algorithm that places child nodes symmetrically around their parent node.
member.remarks: Nodes at the lowest level are arranged directly in a circle around their parent. At the upper level, the already arranged nodes form branches that are arranged in a circle around the new parent node. The algorithm is recursively repeated till the highest level is reached.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.FractalLayout.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the FractalLayout class.

member.summary: Layout.BuildGraph override.

member.summary: Applies the layout to the specified subset of items from the specified Diagram instance.
member.param: The Diagram that should be arranged.
A collection of nodes and links from diagram that define the subgraph to arrange.
member.returns: This method always returns true.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.FractalLayout.Name
member.summary: Gets a user-friendly name of the layout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.FractalLayout.DefaultMarginValue
member.summary: Gets the default value of the Margins property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.FractalLayout.Root
member.summary: Gets or sets the tree root.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.SolarLayout
member.summary: A tree layout algorithm that places child nodes around their parent node, such that the child nodes do not overlap. The algorithm optionally bends the links to prevent them from crossing nodes.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.SolarLayout.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SolarLayout class.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.SolarLayout.BuildGraph(MindFusion.Diagramming.Diagram,MindFusion.Diagramming.DiagramItemCollection)
member.summary: Layout.BuildGraph override.

member.summary: Applies the layout to the specified subset of items from the specified Diagram instance.
member.param: The Diagram that should be arranged.
A collection of nodes and links from diagram that define the subgraph to arrange.
member.returns: This method always returns true.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.SolarLayout.Name
member.summary: Gets a user-friendly name of the layout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.SolarLayout.DefaultMarginValue
member.summary: Gets the default value of the Margins property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.SolarLayout.Root
member.summary: Gets or sets the tree root.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.SolarLayout.KeepRootPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to keep the root node at its original position.
member.value: true to keep the root position; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: If the root position is not kept, that is, the value of this property is false, the entire tree is dispositioned after the layout is complete, according to the values of Margins.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.SolarLayout.LevelDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimal distance between a parent node and its children.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.SolarLayout.NodeDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimal distance between siblings.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.SolarLayout.ReversedLinks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the link direction that relates parent nodes to child nodes.
member.value: true to indicate reversed direction, that is, the parent node is the one the link points to; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.SolarLayout.IgnoreLinkDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the tree layout algorithm should ignore the direction of links when arranging a tree.
member.value: true to ignore link direction; otherwise, false. The default is false.
member.remarks: Parent-child direction is considered the one in which nodes go further from the root, instead that of the links.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.SolarLayout.HonorInitialNodeDisposition
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the initial position of a child node relative to its parent node is preserved in the final layout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Layout.SolarLayout.BendLinks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether links are bend to prevent them from crossing nodes.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.AnchorPattern.TopInBottomOut

member.remarks: This method adds a new item to the selection. It also deactivates the ActiveItem, if any, and makes the newly added item the active one.

member.remarks: Call this method to select an item and make it the ActiveItem. The method doesn't let you select locked items.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LayeredLayoutInfo class.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayoutInfo.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets a the overall orientation of the arranged diagram.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayoutInfo.Direction
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction of the arranged diagram.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayoutInfo.LayerDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired distance between layer axis lines.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayoutInfo.NodeDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired distance between adjacent nodes in a layer.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayoutInfo.Margins
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between the top-left corner of the smallest rectangle containing the arranged diagram and the top-left point of the document bounds.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayoutInfo.SplitLayers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to split layers that are much wider than the other layers.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayoutInfo.SwapPairsIterations
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to try to optimize crossings by performing sequential swapping of adjacent nodes in all levels.
member.remarks: Pair swapping requires substantial amount of time for large and semi-large graphs.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayoutInfo.LinksCompactFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how much to compact the outermost arrows.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayoutInfo.TimeLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets a time-out value for the path-finding part of the layered layout algorithm.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayoutInfo.EnableCustomLayers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the layered layout will honor the LayeredLayoutTraits.Layer flags.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayoutInfo.Statistics
member.summary: Gets layout-specific information about the nodes and links participating in the layout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayoutInfo.EnforceLinkFlow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the layout will force all links to go in the same direction. If the supplied graph has cycles, it will be made acyclic prior the layout.
member.remarks: EnableCustomLayers and SplitLayers are ignored if this property is set to true.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayout.AssignCoordinates
member.summary: Assigns nodes positions using the precalculated grid positions of the nodes within all layers. See the paper "A Fast Layout Algorithm for k-Level Graphs", by Christoph Buchheim, Michael Junger and Sebastian Leipert

member.name: M:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayout.Apply
member.summary: Assigns nodes positions using the precalculated grid positions of the nodes within all layers.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayout.Layout
member.summary: Move nodes to their barycenters, according to their priority but doing so without any node swapping (i.e. the nodes' order remains the same).

member.name: M:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayout.Compact
member.summary: Makes the dummy nodes at the beginning and at the end of each level closer to each other.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayout.MinimizeCrossings
member.summary: Tries to minimize crossings across all levels.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayout.CalcUpData(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates up barycenters and linkCount for the nodes in the layer whose index is specified in the parameter.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayout.CalcDownData(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates down barycenters and linkCount for the nodes in the layer whose index is specified in the parameter.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayout.MinimizeCrossings(System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Tries to minimize crossings between layers 'layer' and 'layer' + 1 if down is true and between layers 'layer' - 1 and 'layer' if down is false.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayout.SwapPairs
member.summary: This method performs a single pass over the graph in an attempt to reduce link crossings through neighbours swapping.

member.summary: Returns the total number of crossings for the links inbetween the specified layers.

member.summary: Calculates the barycenter of a node.
